summary.p: The Āṟāmāvaraviḷakkam, "Light on the sixth boon of the cow" --- not "Light on the sixth great boon", pace Francis (2017, p. 257), as pointed out by Thomas Trautmann in a personal communication --- by Francis Whyte Ellis (1777‒1819), that is, the text known as the The Legend of the Cow-Pox (Trautmann 2006, pp. 231-241). The manuscript contains the original Tamil version (so far, the only one known) and the English translation.

support.p: European paper, watermark fleur-de-lis Curteis and Sons with date 1799.

collation.desc: 2 folios = front guard leaves. Library Arabic pagination 1-4. Blank recto verso.
1 folio = Āṟāmāvaraviḷakkam: Title Page (in Tamil). Library Arabic pagination 5-6. Verso (= page 6) blank.
9 folios = Āṟāmāvaraviḷakkam: Tamil text. Library Arabic pagination 7-24.
1 folio = Āṟāmāvaraviḷakkam: Title Page (in English). Library Arabic pagination 25-26. Verso (= page 26) blank.
11 folios = Āṟāmāvaraviḷakkam: English translation. Library Arabic pagination 27-48.
4 folios = front guard leaves. Library Arabic pagination 49-56. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.foliation: Library Arabic pagination in black pencil 1-56.

handNote.desc: Double-curled kompu is not consistently used.

decoNote.desc: Coat of arms of Frederic North, Earl of Guilford, with his motto LA VERTU EST LA SEULE NOBLESSE (front cover, verso).

additions.desc: ex-libris The Honble Frederic North (front cover, verso).

binding.p: Brown leather cover. Title on the spine.

origin.origDate: No internal date. The terminus a quo is provided by the watemark of the paper. The terminus ad quem is possibly indicated by the fact Frederic North is still called The Honble on his ex-libris, a title he should have ceased to use in 1817, when he became Earl of Guilford, after the successive deaths of his two older brothers.

provenance.p: Owned by Frederic (or or Frederick) North (1766-1827), first Governor of Ceylon (1798–1805), as attested by his ex-libris (front cover, verso).

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
